info.title: FDR - Flussi di Rendicontazione
info.description:
Manage FDR (aka "Flussi di Rendicontazione") exchanged between PSP and EC ## OPERATIONAL ERROR CODES
Details NAME | CODE | ERROR MESSAGE TEMPLATE | DESCRIPTION - | - | - | - **FDR-0500** | *ERROR* | An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support. | An error occurred during computation. This could be
caused by an applicative error and it is probably required
to open an issue. **FDR-1000** | *BAD_REQUEST* | Bad request. | A generic 'Bad Request' error is occurred during request
validation. **FDR-1001** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON* | Bad request. Field [%] is equals to [%] but this is
not a valid value. | A generic error occurred during execution of request
syntactic validation **FDR-1002** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_INSTANT* | Bad request. Field [%] is equals to [%] but it is expected
to be in ISO-8601 format [yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ] (example:
[2025-01-01T12:00:00.123000Z]). | An error occurred during execution of request syntactic
validation, in particular regarding the analysis of
date values **FDR-1003** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_ENUM* | Bad request. Field [%] is equals to [%] but it is expected
to be one of the following values: [%]. | An error occurred during execution of request syntactic
validation, in particular regarding the analysis of
enumerative values **FDR-1004** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_DESERIALIZE_
ERROR* | Bad request. Field [%] generate a deserialization error.
Please, set the correct value. | An error occurred during execution of deserialization
of request from a JSON string **FDR-1005** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_NON_VALID_
FORMAT* | Bad request. The format of JSON request is not valid. | An error occurred during execution of analysis of JSON
request, in particular regarding its format **FDR-2000** | *PSP_UNKNOWN* | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP identifier.
That PSP is not valid and maybe it does not exists
in current environment **FDR-2001** | *PSP_NOT_ENABLED* | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP identifier.
That PSP is not enabled and cannot be used for elaboration **FDR-2002** | *BROKER_UNKNOWN* | PSP Broker with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP Broker identifier.
That PSP Broker is not valid and maybe it does not
exists in current environment **FDR-2003** | *BROKER_NOT_ENABLED* | PSP Broker with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP Broker identifier.
That PSP Broker is not enabled and cannot be used for
elaboration **FDR-2004** | *CHANNEL_UNKNOWN* | Channel with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed Channel identifier.
That Channel is not valid and maybe it does not exists
in current environment **FDR-2005** | *CHANNEL_NOT_ENABLED* | Channel with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed Channel identifier.
That Channel is not enabled and cannot be used for
elaboration **FDR-2006** | *CHANNEL_BROKER_WRONG_CONFIG* | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with
PSP Broker with ID [%]. | An error occurred regarding the passed Channel identifier.
That Channel is not correctly configured for the passed
PSP Broker and cannot be used for elaboration. In order
to be used, it is required to be configured by PagoPA
operator **FDR-2007** | *CHANNEL_PSP_WRONG_CONFIG* | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with
PSP with ID [%]. | An error occurred regarding the passed Channel identifier.
That Channel is not correctly configured for the passed
PSP and cannot be used for elaboration. In order to
be used, it is required to be configured by PagoPA
operator **FDR-2008** | *EC_UNKNOWN* | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed Creditor Institution
identifier. That Creditor Institution is not valid
and maybe it does not exists in current environment **FDR-2009** | *EC_NOT_ENABLED* | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed Creditor Institution
identifier. That Creditor Institution is not enabled
and cannot be used for elaboration **FDR-3001** | *REPORTING_FLOW_NOT_FOUND* | Flow with ID [%] not found. | An error occurred during the search of reporting flow.
The needed flow does not exists in current environment **FDR-3002** | *REPORTING_FLOW_ALREADY_EXIST* | Flow with ID [%] already exists with [%] status. | An error occurred during the search of reporting flow.
The flow being created already exists in CREATED/INSERTED
status and cannot be overridden. The existing flow
must be deleted in order to create another flow with
the same name. **FDR-3003** | *REPORTING_FLOW_WRONG_ACTION* | Flow with ID [%] exists with [%] status. | An error occurred during the search of reporting flow.
The flow being updated cannot be handled with some
kind of action (for example, trying to publish a flow
in CREATED status) **FDR-3004** | *REPORTING_FLOW_PSP_ID_NOT_MATCH* | Flow with ID [%] have field sender.pspId [%] that does
not match with query param [%]. | An error occurred during flow analysis. The value of
PSP identifier set on query parameter is not equals
to the one defined in the request. So, it is required
to update one of them in order to proceed. **FDR-3005** | *REPORTING_FLOW_PAYMENT_SAME_INDEX_
IN_SAME_REQUEST* | There are one or more identical payment indexes in
same request for flow with ID [%]. | An error occurred during flow analysis regarding the
included payments. In particular, there are at least
one index that is duplicated in the request and it
is required to delete them in order to proceed. **FDR-3006** | *REPORTING_FLOW_PAYMENT_DUPLICATE_
INDEX* | One or more payment index already added on flow with
ID [%]. | An error occurred during flow analysis regarding the
included payments. In particular, there are at least
one index that is duplicated in the whole flow and
it is required to exclude them in the request in order
to proceed. **FDR-3007** | *REPORTING_FLOW_PAYMENT_NO_MATCH_
INDEX* | Index of payment not match with index loaded on flow
with ID [%]. | An error occurred during flow analysis regarding the
included payments. In particular, there are at least
one index that does not exists in the whole flow it
is required to delete them from request in order to
proceed. **FDR-3008** | *REPORTING_FLOW_NAME_DATE_WRONG_
FORMAT* | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. | An error occurred during execution of analysis on flow
identifier. In particular, the date included in the
identifier is not correctly formatted and it is not
compliant with SANP specification **FDR-3009** | *REPORTING_FLOW_NAME_PSP_WRONG_FORMAT* | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. | An error occurred during execution of analysis on flow
identifier. In particular, the PSP Identifier included
in the flow identifier is not correct and it is not
compliant with SANP specification **FDR-3010** | *REPORTING_FLOW_NAME_NOT_MATCH* | Field fdr [%] does not match with query param [%]. | An error occurred during flow analysis. The value of
flow identifier set on query parameter is not equals
to the one defined in the request. So, it is required
to update one of them in order to proceed. **FDR-4001** | *REPORTING_FLOW_WRONG_TOT_PAYMENT* | On flow with ID [%], [%] payments were defined to be
added but [%] were actually added. | An error occurred during flow analysis before publish
operation. In particular, the number of total payments
added by previous steps are not equals to the quantity
pre-defined in flow during creation process. **FDR-4002** | *REPORTING_FLOW_WRONG_SUM_PAYMENT* | On flow with ID [%], an amount of [%] euro for all
payments were defined to be added but [%] is actually
calculated. | An error occurred during flow analysis before publish
operation. In particular, the number of total amout
for payments added by previous steps are not equals
to the quantity pre-defined in flow during creation
process.

get.summary: Get all draft flows related to the PSP
get.description: Get all draft flows related to the PSP

parameters.name: pspId
parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter

parameters.name: createdGt
parameters.description: A date to be used as a lower limit search on creation date. In format ISO-8601 (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The index of the page to be shown in the result

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of the elements of the page to be shown in the result

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

payments.description: The list of payments to be added on the draft flow

fdr.description:
The value of the flow identifier.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoFlusso].

regulation.description:
The description related to the regulation payment related to the flow.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.identificativoUnivocoRegolamento].

bicCodePouringBank.description:
The BIC code of the bank where the regulation payment related to the flow will be poured.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.codiceBicBancaDiRiversamento].

totPayments.description:
The total number of payments to be included in the flow during the flow compilation.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.numeroTotalePagamenti].

sumPayments.description:
The total amount of payments to be calculated in the flow during the flow compilation.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.importoTotalePagamenti].

indexList.description: The list of payments indexes to be removed on the draft flow

path.description: The path reference for the specific error clause in the general response.

message.description: The descriptive message for the specific error clause in the general response.
example: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

errorId.description: The unique identifier that can be used for tracking request and error response.

httpStatusCode.description: The HTTP status code related to the error message.

httpStatusDescription.description: The descriptive name of the HTTP status code.

appErrorCode.description: The operational error code related to the error response

errors.description: The list of specific errors to show for the error response.

fdr.description: The unique identifier of the flow.

organizationId.description: The domain identifier of the creditor institution related to the flow.

revision.description: The revision (or version) of the flow.

revision.description: The revision (or version) of the flow.

message.description: The descriptive information that shows a message related to the executed operation.

name.description: The identificative name of the deployed application

version.description: The current version of the deployed application

environment.description: The current environment where the application is deployed

description.description: The descriptive information related to the info response

pageSize.description: The size of the current page shown in response

pageNumber.description: The index of the current page shown in response

totPage.description: The total number of the pages that can be retrieved in order to show all elements.

count.description: The number of elements that can be found in this page.

data.description: The list of flows that are included in this page.

count.description: The number of elements that can be found in this page.

data.description: The list of flows that are included in this page.

count.description: The number of elements that can be found in this page.

data.description: The list of payments that are included in this page.

index.description: Unique index of the payment in the flow

iuv.description:
The value of the 'Identificativo Univoco Versamento' code related to the payment.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.identificativoUnivocoVersamento].

iur.description:
The value of the 'Identificativo Univoco Riscossione' code related to the payment in the flow.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.identificativoUnivocoRiscossione].

idTransfer.description:
The value of the transfer identifier related to the payment during the payment process.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.indiceDatiSingoloPagamento].

pay.description:
The value of the payment amount in decimal euro.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.singoloImportoPagato].

payStatus.description:
The value of the status of the payment in relation to ist completion.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.codiceEsitoSingoloPagamento].
The enumeration is mapped with the following values:
  • EXECUTED -> 0
  • REVOKED -> 3
  • STAND_IN -> 4
  • STAND_IN_NO_RPT -> 8
  • NO_RPT -> 9

id.description:
The identifier of the Creditor Institution receiver entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoRicevente.identificativoUnivocoRicevente.codiceIdentificativoUnivoco].

organizationId.description:
The domain identifier of the Creditor Institution receiver entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoDominio].

organizationName.description:
The fiscal name of the Creditor Institution receiver entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoRicevente.denominazioneRicevente].

id.description:
The identifier of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoMittente.identificativoUnivocoMittente.codiceIdentificativoUnivoco].

pspId.description:
The domain identifier of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoPSP].

pspName.description:
The fiscal name of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoMittente.denominazioneMittente].

pspBrokerId.description:
The domain identifier of the PSP sender entity's Broker.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoIntermediarioPSP].

channelId.description:
The identifier of the PSP sender entity's Channel.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoCanale].

password.description:
The password of the PSP sender entity's Channel.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.password].

revision.description: The revision (or version) of the flow.

fdr.description: The unique identifier of the flow.

regulation.description: The description related to the regulation payment related to the flow.

bicCodePouringBank.description: The BIC code of the bank where the regulation payment related to the flow will be poured.

computedTotPayments.description: The computed total number of payments included in the flow during the compilation.

computedSumPayments.description: The computed total amount of payments calculated in the flow during the compilation.

totPayments.description: The total number of payments to be included in the flow during the flow compilation.

sumPayments.description: The total amount of payments to be calculated in the flow during the flow compilation.

tags.name: PSP
tags.description: APIs for payment service providers, used for creation and inspection of flows
